page.title: 08SHOPPING TRENDS IN WETHERBY
page.content: Being a market town, Wetherby can offer a wide range of shopping amenities, including an open market once a week, two supermarkets, and various other shops, ranging from agricultural suppliers to linen shops. Overall, Wetherby can cater for the majority of shopper's weekly needs. More specialised items such as furniture can be obtained from nearby larger shopping centres such as Leeds, York and Harrogate. Since the opening of the Horsefair Centre in 1978, Wetherby's shopping area has become centralised around this pedestrian precinct near the town centre. The precinct contains a large supermarket and other smaller shops. There is an abundance of estate agents and building societies around the market place. Basically, Wetherby is a small town serving a wide rural area.
